com.reice.imc.racestopwatch

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reice.imc.racestopwatch.Clock

  • public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object
    Timer object and thread.

    Has two modes (MODE_STOPWATCH and MODE_COUNTDOWN); clock's mode field is mode. Access to the fields via getValues() The Handler callback will be notified about changes.

    Because of device power saving, there are methods to adjust the clock when our app is paused/resumed: #onAppPause(), #onAppResume(). Otherwise the counting would become inaccurate.

    Has three states:

    • Reset: This is the initial state. In STOP mode, the hour, minute, second are 0. In COUNTDOWN mode they're (h, m, s), copied from spinners when the user hits the "refresh" button.
    • Started: The clock is running.
    • Stopped: The clock is not currently running, but it's changed from the initial values. That is, the clock is paused, and the user can start it to continue counting.
    You can examine the current state by reading isActive() and #wasStarted. To reset the clock again, and/or change the mode, call reset() or setCountdown(int, int, int).

    When running, a thread (clockThread) either counts up (stopwatchRunnable) or down (countdownRunnable), firing every 100ms. The callback handler will be notified. See Clock(int, Handler) for details about how.

    To lap, call #lap(StringBuffer). Note that persisting the lap data arrays at Activity.onStop must be done in AnstopActivity, not here. #fillSaveState(Bundle) stores the lap data arrays, but there's no corresponding method to save long arrays to SharedPreferences.

    Lap display formatting is done through flags such as #LAP_FMT_FLAG_DELTA and the nested class Clock.LapFormatter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Clock

        public Clock(int mode,
     Handler callback)
        Constructs a new Clock Object. The mode indicates how the clock should count. If there is an update, the background Thread will send a Message to the handler. The first Argument of the Message (msg.arg1) will be what should be updated (eg. UPDATE_DECI_SECONDS), the second to which value.
        Parameters:
        mode - MODE_STOPWATCH or MODE_COUNTDOWN
        callback - Handler to update UI
        See Also:
        UPDATE_DECI_SECONDS, UPDATE_SECONDS, UPDATE_MINUTES, UPDATE_HOURS

    • Method Detail

      • count

        public void count()
        Starts counting in a background thread

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Interrupts the counting Thread.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Indicates if the Clock is currently counting and a Background Thread is running.
        Returns:
        true if active

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets hours, minutes, seconds, and deci seconds to zero. Only resets, if not running (ie. isActive() returns false)

      • setCountdown

        public void setCountdown(int hours,
                int minutes,
                int seconds)
        Sets the values from which should be counted down.
        Parameters:
        hours -
        minutes -
        seconds -

      • getValues

        public int[] getValues()
        Returns the current time values. The first value are the hours, the second the minutes, third the seconds and the last the deci seconds.

        That means, for example you can get the current seconds with getValues()[2]

        Attention: Not thread safe!

        Returns:
        array representing the current values.

      • saveState

        public void saveState(Context context)
        Saves the state to the Preferences. Stops the clock. Saves the current time vaules like minutes, seconds, hours and deci seconds. Saves the state (isActive()) and the time this method was called (System.currentTimeMillis()). Prints an error to android Log system if saving fails.
        Parameters:
        context - Context needed to access settings.
        See Also:
        restoreState(Context)

      • restoreState

        public void restoreState(Context context)
        Restores the state from the Preferences. Starts the clock if was active.
        Parameters:
        context - Context needed to access settings.
        See Also:
        saveState(Context)

      • newLap

        public Clock.Lap newLap()
        Creates a new lap with the current time values and puts it in the private list laps.
        Returns:
        The newly created lap.
        See Also:
        getLaps()

      • getLaps

        public java.util.List<Clock.Lap> getLaps()
        Returns the list the current laps are put in.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable List of laps
